Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.10691983]55% hemolysis at 10 μM, 90% hemolysis at 20 μM, 95% hemolysis at 40μM, 100% hemolysis at 60 μM against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Comments: Relative to Temporins A, B, and H, temporin D showed the greatest hemolytic activity. Thus, although it lacks antibacterial activity, this peptide may also plays a role in host defense by showing toxicity to eukaryotes) (Eur. J Biochem 2000; 267 1447-1454).

Literature.Title: Temporins, antimicrobial peptides from the European red frog Rana temporaria.
Literature.Author: Simmaco M, Mignogna G, Canofeni S, Miele R, Mangoni ML, Barra D.

Literature.Title: Structure-function relationships of temporins, small antimicrobial peptides from amphibian skin.
Literature.Author: Mangoni ML, Rinaldi AC, Di Giulio A, Mignogna G, Bozzi A, Barra D, Simmaco M.
